Detailed Description

Provides C++ wrapper around MPI routines.

SAMRAI_MPI provides a single point of access in SAMRAI for using MPI function calls and for the run-time decision whether to use MPI. The purpose of having a single point is to facilitate writing code that is not cluttered by the repetitive logic absorbed into this class. Codes accessing MPI through this class should work whether SAMRAI is configured with or without MPI and whether MPI is enabled at run time.

This class provides two sets of interfaces:

  1. Methods closely matching the MPI interfaces associated with a communicator. The communicator is set during object construction and is removed from the argument list of the MPI-like interfaces.
  1. Static methods exactly matching the MPI interfaces not associated with any specific communicator.

If SAMRAI has MPI enabled, the MPI wrappers in this class delegate to the real MPI methods. Otherwise, they are no-ops and will throw an assertion if used, except for those specifically identified as able to work without MPI enabled. The purpose of these interfaces are strictly to check whether MPI was configured into SAMRAI and SAMRAI is using MPI at run time. They are not "single-process implementations" of the MPI standard.

This class also manages a central SAMRAI_MPI object meant for SAMRAI's general use. See getSAMRAIWorld() and init().

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef int SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::Comm

Aliases for MPI data type names.

Define aliases for MPI types that can be used whether SAMRAI is configured with or without MPI. Without MPI, these types are "dummies", used to allow the code to be compiled without changes.

typedef int SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::Datatype
typedef int SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::Group
typedef int SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::Op
typedef int SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::Request

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::SAMRAI_MPI ( const Comm &  comm  )  [explicit]

Constructor.

The given MPI communicator will be used for all communications invoked by this object.

Note that the object will NOT automatically free the communicator. To manually free the communicator, use freeCommunicator().

If the specified communicator is MPI_COMM_NULL, the rank (see getRank()) and size (see getSize()) are set to invalid values. Otherwise, the rank and size are set using the given communicator. If MPI is enabled but MPI has not been initialized, the rank and size are set to invalid values. If MPI is not enabled, the rank is set to 0 and size to 1.

Parameters:
[in] comm 

References MPI_COMM_NULL.

SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::SAMRAI_MPI ( const SAMRAI_MPI &  other  ) 

Copy constructor.

Member Function Documentation

static const SAMRAI_MPI& SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::getSAMRAIWorld (  )  [inline, static]

Get the primary SAMRAI_MPI object owned by SAMRAI.

This is SAMRAI's primary communication object set up when SAMRAI_MPI is initialized. It is used for basic communications that are not associated with another communication object. Various parts of the SAMRAI library may create and use (and destroy) communicators that are derived from this object.

The use of this object outside of the SAMRAI library should be carefully limited to avoid mixing messages.

After SAMRAI_MPI::init() and before SAMRAI_MPI::finalize(), the object returned is useable. Otherwise it is intentionally invalid.

See also:
init()

void SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::dupCommunicator ( const SAMRAI_MPI &  other  ) 

Duplicate and internally use the communicator of a given SAMRAI_MPI object.

Note that this call does not automatically free the existing communicator. The duplicate communicator will also NOT be automatically freed. To manually free communicators, see freeCommunicator().

If SAMRAI isn't configured with MPI, the duplicate is an identical copy.

Parameters:
[in] other Contains the communicator to be duplicated.

References Comm_dup(), MPI_SUCCESS, TBOX_ASSERT, and TBOX_ERROR.

Referenced by SAMRAI::mesh::TreeLoadBalancer::setSAMRAI_MPI(), SAMRAI::mesh::CascadePartitioner::setSAMRAI_MPI(), SAMRAI::hier::OverlapConnectorAlgorithm::setSAMRAI_MPI(), SAMRAI::hier::MappingConnectorAlgorithm::setSAMRAI_MPI(), SAMRAI::mesh::BergerRigoutsos::useDuplicateMPI(), and SAMRAI::appu::VisItDataWriter::VisItDataWriter().

void SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::freeCommunicator (  ) 

Free the internal communicator and set it to MPI_COMM_NULL.

If the internal communicator is already MPI_COMM_NULL, do nothing.

References Comm_free(), MPI_COMM_NULL, TBOX_ASSERT, and usingMPI().

Referenced by SAMRAI::mesh::TreeLoadBalancer::freeMPICommunicator(), SAMRAI::mesh::CascadePartitioner::freeMPICommunicator(), SAMRAI::mesh::TreeLoadBalancer::setSAMRAI_MPI(), SAMRAI::mesh::CascadePartitioner::setSAMRAI_MPI(), SAMRAI::hier::OverlapConnectorAlgorithm::setSAMRAI_MPI(), SAMRAI::hier::MappingConnectorAlgorithm::setSAMRAI_MPI(), SAMRAI::mesh::BergerRigoutsos::useDuplicateMPI(), SAMRAI::mesh::BergerRigoutsos::~BergerRigoutsos(), SAMRAI::hier::MappingConnectorAlgorithm::~MappingConnectorAlgorithm(), SAMRAI::hier::OverlapConnectorAlgorithm::~OverlapConnectorAlgorithm(), and SAMRAI::appu::VisItDataWriter::~VisItDataWriter().

int SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::compareCommunicator ( const SAMRAI_MPI &  other  )  const

Compare with another SAMRAI_MPI's communicator.

If MPI is enabled, compare using Comm_compare, and return the result. Otherwise, return MPI_IDENT if the two communicators are the same and MPI_CONGRUENT if they are not. (No other choice makes sense when MPI is disabled.)

Performance of this method depends on underlying MPI implementation and may not scale.

References Comm_compare(), MPI_CONGRUENT, MPI_IDENT, MPI_SUCCESS, NULL_USE, and TBOX_ERROR.

Referenced by isCongruentWith().

bool SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::hasNullCommunicator (  )  const [inline]

int SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::Comm_rank ( Comm  comm,
int *  rank 
) [static]

MPI wrappers that don't use the internal communicator.

The purpose of these wrappers is to provide a single place for compile- and run-time toggling of MPI code. The signatures and return values of these methods are identical to the MPI C bindings. These methods will throw an assertion if they are called when MPI is not enabled.

Precondition:
s_mpi_is_initialized

References MPI_SUCCESS, NULL_USE, and TBOX_ERROR.

double SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::Wtime (  )  [static]

MPI Wtime (if MPI is enabled) or an alternate time calculation.

Returns:
If MPI is running, use Wtime. If not, but POSIX time is available, use that. Else return 0.0.

int SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::Allgather ( void *  sendbuf,
int  sendcount,
Datatype  sendtype,
void *  recvbuf,
int  recvcount,
Datatype  recvtype 
) const

MPI wrappers for methods associated with an MPI communicator.

The purpose of these wrappers is to provide a single place for compile- and run-time toggling of MPI code. The signatures and return values of these methods are identical to the MPI C bindings, except that the communicators are omitted. The communicator used is that associated with the SAMRAI_MPI object (typically passed to the constructor). These methods throw an assertion if called while MPI is not enabled, except where noted.

Precondition:
s_mpi_is_initialized

References MPI_SUCCESS, NULL_USE, and TBOX_ERROR.

int SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::AllReduce ( int *  x,
int  count,
Op  op,
int *  ranks_of_extrema = 0 
) const

Specialized Allreduce for integers.

If MPI_MINLOC or MPI_MAXLOC is given as the operator, the ranks_of_extrema argument must be provided with space allocated for count integers.

Returns:
MPI error code
Parameters:
[in,out] x Array of integers to reduce.
[in] count Number of items in x.
[in] op A valid MPI reduce operation.
[out] ranks_of_extrema Ranks associated with min or max of x (if op indicates min or max operation).
Precondition:
(op != MPI_MINLOC && op != MPI_MAXLOC) || (ranks_of_extrema != 0)
s_mpi_is_initialized

int SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::parallelPrefixSum ( int *  x,
int  count,
int  tag 
) const

Parallel prefix sum for integers.

Given an input x, the output is the sum of x from process 0 up to and including the local process's x. This implementation allows an array of x, each of which is summed independently of the other.

Parameters:
[in,out] x Array of integers to sum.
[in] count Number of items in x. Must be the same on all processes.
[in] tag MPI tag for communication.
Returns:
MPI_SUCCESS or an MPI error code.

References Irecv(), Isend(), MPI_INT, MPI_SUCCESS, NULL_USE, and Wait().

bool SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::hasReceivableMessage ( Status *  status = 0,
int  source = MPI_ANY_SOURCE,
int  tag = MPI_ANY_TAG 
) const

Check whether there a message waiting to be received.

This is a convenience (non-essential) interface for use in debugging communication code. It checks whether there are any waiting to be received. It uses a non-blocking check; a false doesn't mean no messages are coming; it means no messages have arrived. The checking includes barriers, making this a collective operation.

Parameters:
[in,out] status 
[in] source 
[in] tag 
Returns:
Whether any messages matching the source and tag are waiting to be received.

References Barrier(), Iprobe(), MPI_SUCCESS, and TBOX_ERROR.

Referenced by SAMRAI::tbox::Schedule::communicate(), SAMRAI::hier::Connector::computeTransposeOf(), and SAMRAI::hier::OverlapConnectorAlgorithm::findOverlaps_assumedPartition().

static void SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::setCallAbortInSerialInsteadOfExit ( bool  flag = true  )  [inline, static]

Set flag indicating whether exit or MPI_Abort is called when running with one processor.

Calling this function influences the behavior of calls to SAMRAI_MPI::abort(). If the value set is true, it means that system abort() will be called. Passing false means exit(-1) will be called.

Referenced by init(), and initMPIDisabled().

static void SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::setCallAbortInParallelInsteadOfMPIAbort ( bool  flag = true  )  [inline, static]

Set flag indicating whether MPI_Abort or abort is called when running with more than one processor.

Calling this function influences the behavior of calls to SAMRAI_MPI::abort(). If the value set is true, it means that system abort() will be called. Passing false means MPI_Abort will be called.

Referenced by init(), and initMPIDisabled().

void SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::abort (  )  [static]

Call MPI_Abort or exit depending on whether running with one or more processes and value set by function above, if called.

The default is to call exit(-1) if running with one processor and to call MPI_Abort() otherwise. This function avoids having to guard abort calls in application code.

References getCommunicator(), getSAMRAIWorld(), and getSize().

static void SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::disableMPI (  )  [static]

Disable MPI usage and run in sequential mode.

The default setting is to enable MPI at run-time if SAMRAI was configured with MPI and to disable if SAMRAI was not configured with MPI. This method disables MPI in the former case.

If MPI is disabled for SAMRAI, the communication interfaces in this class are no-ops and will throw an assertion if used, except for those interfaces specifically described as working in sequential mode.

Disabling MPI must be done before calling SAMRAI_MPI::init().

static bool SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::usingMPI (  )  [inline, static]

Whether SAMRAI is using MPI (configured, compiled and initialized).

See also:
disableMPI().

Referenced by SAMRAI::tbox::AsyncCommStage::advanceAny(), SAMRAI::tbox::AsyncCommStage::advanceSome(), freeCommunicator(), and SAMRAI::hier::BoxLevelConnectorUtils::makeSortingMap().

void SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::init ( int *  argc,
char **  argv[] 
) [static]

Initialize MPI and SAMRAI_MPI.

This initialization sets up getSAMRAIWorld() to return an SAMRAI_MPI object with a communicator duplicated from MPI_COMM_WORLD.

Use only one of the three initialization methods.

Parameters:
[in] argc Pointer to parameter from main()
[in] argv Pointer to parameter from main()

References MPI_COMM_WORLD, NULL_USE, setCallAbortInParallelInsteadOfMPIAbort(), setCallAbortInSerialInsteadOfExit(), and setCommunicator().

Initialize SAMRAI_MPI when MPI is already initialized.

This initialization sets up getSAMRAIWorld() to return an SAMRAI_MPI object with a communicator duplicated from the one passed in.

Use only one of the three initialization methods.

void SAMRAI::tbox::SAMRAI_MPI::finalize (  )  [static]

Shut down SAMRAI_MPI and, if appropriate, shut down MPI.

This method frees the MPI communicator duplicated for SAMRAI use. If this class has started MPI with the first init() method, finalize() will also shut down MPI.

References MPI_COMM_NULL.
